intro: Zollikoferia prenanthoides, commonly known as the dwarf lily of the valley, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15 cm and features dark green, strap-like leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its fragrant blooms and ability to naturalize over time.
